item.title: Kim So-wol meets Hyun Jin-geon at the old warehouse “Incheon Korean Modern Literature Museum” - Jung-gu, Incheon, Korea
item.description:
Korea Modern Literature Museum, which remodeled the warehouse of the opening port

Kim So-wol meets Hyun Jin-geon at the old warehouse “Incheon Korean Modern Literature Museum”

Jung-gu, Incheon, Korea

Old ones always stimulate fragrance. Museums that remodel old warehouses are more attractive than sophisticated museums of high-tech architecture. The Korean Modern Literature Museum opened in the cultural district of Incheon Port, which is filled with modern culture. This is the only literary museum that encompasses Korean modern literature. On the outer wall, the time and frivolity of the old warehouse remain unchanged.

The cultural district of the opening port of Jung-gu, Incheon, strangely resembles Brooklyn, New York. It is similar to remodeling an old warehouse and using it as a gallery and workshop for artists, and it is similar that the muzzle and railroad tracks in and out of containers are entangled. When you step up to the free park behind the cultural district, you can see the railroads leading to the sea and Incheon Station, shabby warehouses and art spaces, and panoramic views of old houses. The Korean Modern Literature Museum was opened this fall at the cultural district of the opening port of Asrahan.

Incheon Art Platform
The Korean Museum of Modern Literature is a place where Incheon City and Incheon Cultural Foundation reorganized the warehouse of logistics for 100 years as a literary museum from a humanistic perspective. The museum contains the old warmth. The atmosphere of the old port is looming from the sluggish exterior walls and wooden ceilings of the warehouse built during the Japanese occupation.
Inside the Korea Modern Literature Museum
The Literature Museum also saved the significance of modern history ten minutes. The Incheon Open Port is where the modern culture of Incheon, a port city, still lives and breathes. The Museum of Modern Literature is the only Korean literature that preserves modern literature from the Enlightenment Period of the 1890s to the late 1940s. Although there are about 60 literary museums in Korea, it is the only literary museum that encompasses modern literature, leaving a certain literary and religious school.
Works by period
Exhibition of rare works of old literary people
The Korean Museum of Modern Literature has nearly 30,000 items. You can encounter the works of literary artists such as Choi Nam-sun, Han Yong-woon, Kim So-wol, Nado-hyang, Hyun Jin-geon, Baekseok, Yeom Sang-seop, etc. The strange scent of the spirit springs up from faded rare texts, such as the first edition of Korea's first Korean-language mix, Yu Gil-jun's 《Seoul Yomunmun》, and Yeom Sang-seop ’s 《Mansejeon》.
Korea Modern Literature Museum outside
The Korean Modern Literature Museum stands side by side with Incheon Art Platform, Incheon's representative art creation space. Reflecting the local characteristics, the literature museum also stands out as an attempt to integrate differently with art.
Stamp experience
The visit to the Museum of Modern Literature starts with a special exhibition of later writers. Hwang Soon-Woo's 'Treasure Warehouse' exhibition is an exhibition that contains traces of bricks and wood buried in walls and ceilings in the process of reconstructing a newly built warehouse building as a literary museum. This special exhibition will continue until November 17th.
Wall with literary faces
At the permanent exhibition hall of the Literature Museum, you can examine the history and major works of literature by period. With the period of Enlightenment, Taedonggi of Modern Literature, and Kim So-wol and Han Yong-un, along with the period of social absurdity, poets and novels of literary people who have pinched social absurdity can be appreciated. The most prominent space in the exhibition hall is the place where the faces of literary artists are gathered all over the wall. If you download a separate app, you can listen to explanations about novelists and works and take a commemorative photo here.
2nd floor exhibition hall
Inside the exhibition hall, movies based on the lives of ordinary people during the turbulent times are screened every hour. You can also enjoy the slides of the memories that have soaked in the works in front of Hyunjin Geon's “Good Day of Transport.” In the experience space on the 2nd floor, there are stamps with the images of the major artists of each era encountered on the 1st floor. You can also post a postal stamp and remember the time.
Entrance to the movie theater in the literature hall
Artworks and their traces set in the background of an open port
The area near the Korean Modern Literature Museum is a space for viewing the cultural district of the open port. In fact, on weekends, Chinatown, which is crowded with restaurants selling Jjajangmyeon, is a busy place. If you want to enjoy the quiet old-time buildings and artworks and enjoy a quiet stroll, the road opposite the Freedom Park leading to Jung-gu Office is good. As you enter the alleyway of the cultural district, the teahouses that entered the old Japanese houses are warm, and the buildings that transformed from the banks to museums during the opening of the port, such as the Open Port Museum and the Modern Architecture Center, stand out. The tea houses have a cozy atmosphere that old literary people might have stopped by. In fact, nearby Wolmido and Freedom Park also served as backgrounds for literary works. Yeom Sang-seop portrayed the atmosphere of the opening port at the time in his novel, "Issim", published in 1928.
“The car ran around the coast where the man was double-stretched like a market day and ran to Manguk Park. But today it is also crowded with people. A group of secondary school students and a procession of female students are also seen in front. Perhaps these students are coming in to watch the concert. ”
The path from the Modern Literature Museum to the Freedom Park through the Cultural Port of the Open Port is full of a deep autumn atmosphere. As you walk along the street, novels and poems from old literary artists hover around the streets to encourage speculation.
Freedom Park's Chinese Munru
Travel information

item.title: Trusted food restaurants and pubs, old restaurants loved by Incheon citizens - Jung-gu, Incheon, Korea
item.description:
'Myeongwoljip', kimchi jjigae

Trusted food restaurants and pubs, old restaurants loved by Incheon citizens

Jung-gu, Incheon, Korea

It is an old restaurant, a bar, and a restaurant that keeps its place wherever it comes. There is a familiar taste and a comfortable atmosphere, and stories and stories that have been accumulated for many years flow. It wasn't a national restaurant, but I visited Incheon's oldest restaurants that have shared joy with locals. It's easily accessible by train, and it's also a great day trip because it's easy to visit, including Chinatown, modern cultural heritage, Sinpo International Market, and art platforms.

Myeongwoljip, a simple rice house that has been around for over 50 years

Around Incheon Station and Dong-Incheon Station (National Railway Line 1), that is, Jung-gu, where Chinatown and Sinpo International Market are located, has long been the center of Incheon. In the mid-1980s, as the Incheon City Hall moved to Namdong-gu, it was difficult to find the same vitality as it moved to Sanggwon-do. It is a special place that buried memories and longing.

Scenery in front of Jung-gu Office in Incheon
Opened in 1966 and opened for generations, Myeongwoljip is a restaurant that has been loved as one and only alum (7,000 won) for over 50 years. Since it is a single menu, there is no need to order separately. If you just sit down and talk to the number of people, bring the dish to the tray after a while. Kimchi, radish greens, mushroom stir-fry, egg roll, tofu stew, and mackerel stew are like eating at home.
Myeongwoljip
The types of side dishes change little by little, but egg rolls and fish stew are not always missing. Counting, there are nine side dishes except soup. However, the amount is reasonable and the liver is moderate, so there is little left.
Myeongwoljip restaurant
However, the real main character of Myeongwoljip is separate. This is kimchi jjigae, which is boiling all day long on a corner of a restaurant, on a rare oil stove these days. It is a “self” menu that customers eat and eat, but you can refill as many times as you like. A bowl of kimchi stew with plenty of thick pork cuts into it, and the air in the rice is soaking up quickly. You can bring any number of vegetables, such as lettuce, Chinese cabbage, and green pepper, which are always prepared on the shelf next to the stove.
Infinitely refillable kimchi stew
Myeongwoljip was also named in the “100 Old Korean Restaurants Loved by Koreans” announced by the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries and the Korean Food Foundation in 2012. Myeongwoljip and Ganghwa-gun's Wooriok were selected side by side as the ‘baekban’. It's a bit awkward to have a new signboard that doesn't have the atmosphere of an old restaurant. Except for the phrase 'Since 1966', which is a small sign at the entrance, there is no element to notice that it is an old restaurant.
Infinitely refillable kimchi stew
Local food in Incheon, Haejangguk Pyeongyangok
In Incheon, there is another restaurant selected as '100 old Korean restaurants that Koreans love.' It is 'Pyongyang Ok', which was opened in 1945 by a senior Kim Seok-ha couple from Sunan, Pyongyang. It belongs to Jung-gu, the same as Myeongwoljip in the administrative district, but if Myeongwoljip is within walking distance from Incheon Station and Chinatown, Pyeongyangok is close to Dowon Station, two stops away from Incheon Station.
The representative menu of Pyongyang Ok is Haejangguk (11,000 won), which is boiled with boiled Chinese cabbage and boiled with miso and boiled cabbage. It is soft and tender with thick broth and soft ribs in clear broth.
As you know, Incheon was a port for the opening of the Japanese colonial rule, where the goods were common and people gathered a lot. At that time, there were many Haejanggukjips that targeted them in Sinpo-dong and Dap-dong, lined with white banyan houses.
Inside pyongyang

Haejangguk is the most popular, but galbitang is as good as it is, and you can taste cold noodles and bulgogi. However, you can only order one Haejangguk from 5 am to 11 am. The restaurant building, which was a small hanok, was destroyed by a fire and turned into a two-story building. It is said that many presidents and famous politicians have visited.

Haejangguk, the representative menu of Pyongyang Ok
It's an Incheon-style multi-family house where you don't know about Incheon.
Although it was only known to the outsiders as “Shinpo Market Chicken Gangjeong,” Sinpo-dong is a neighborhood with many friendly pubs where you can lightly drink a glass of soju. Dabokjip, Manyangjip, Yeomyeomjip, Daejeonjip, Popeye ... The name of each other is also pretty. What these pubs have in common is that they are old, that they sell various kinds of wares and sujitang, and that the snack prices are really good.
Tea house
Among them, 'Dabokjip', located in the back alley of Sinpo-dong, is a mountain history of Sinpo-dong, where wife and children have been succeeding and succeeding after Han Bok-su, the first president of the company. It is said that literary artists and artists in Incheon went in and out of the threshold. Among them, poet Choi Seung-ryul, who had been active in Incheon for a long time, was the representative. A piece of Choi's face is hanging under the signboard, and there is also a poem in the store. For the first time to visit Dabokjip, the form of the signboard and the typeface and the two-digit phone number are more interesting than the strange story.
Mouth-watering, multi-storey snacks
The main menu of this house is Sujitang. The suji is a tendon that is attached to the cow's avalanche and has a similar texture and taste. In other stores, such as Manyangjip and Yeomyeomjip, Sujitang is a clear soup, while Dabokjip is red with red pepper seasoning.
The 1st president and the poet Choi's jin, outfits are hanging

item.title: The scenery of the island off the coast of Incheon is at a glance ~ Muui Sea Nurigil in Somuuido Island - Jung-gu, Incheon, Korea
item.description:
Footbridge that connects Somuido

The scenery of the island off the coast of Incheon is at a glance ~ Muui Sea Nurigil in Somuuido Island

Jung-gu, Incheon, Korea

In autumn, let's take a walk on a quiet island road. This is an island beach road that goes only by chubby boats and does not even drive. Muuido has long been known for its drama location, Hana Beach, and Horyonggoksan Mountain, but it is only recently that Somuuido, the younger brother of the island, has been word of mouth. As the bridge is laid from Samui Kumipo-gu, Muui-do to Somuui-do, and the path of Muui-San-Nuri is created, the path of those seeking it is increasing.

On weekends, the road to Muui-do became quite convenient. In the past, I changed buses two or three times, but these days, the Incheon Airport Railroad connects to Yongyu Temporary Station every weekend. When you get off at the train station, you can walk to the Jamjindo dock where the boat to Muuido departs and walk to the sea next to it. If you take a boat from Jamjindo Pier, it is only 5 minutes to Muuido Island. Ships run every 20 to 30 minutes, and buses come and go from time to time on the island, so there is no need to drive a car and enter the island.
Somuido Island
In fact, when I go to see the scenery of a secluded fishing village, there is nothing as frustrating as a passenger car overflowing. If you take a minibus from Muuido Pier, run across the island to Gwangmyeong Port on the other side. The tour of Somuido Island, walking on a quiet island, begins by sitting in the back of the bus and opening a car window and taking a deep breath. When the bus crossing the steep hills becomes as dark as it grows, other scenery of Muuido Island unfolds. The port is more familiar to the residents than the Gwangmyeong Port as Samkumi Village, and the small intention is curled across the port.
Celeb's beach
A secluded island village connected by footbridge
In the past, the only way to connect Muuido with Soouido was by boat. Somuuido, the west and east villages were blocked by mountains, so you had to walk over mountain paths or go by boat. In Samkumi, the bridge started connecting the western village of Somuuido Island, and the island began to thrive as the Muui Sea Nuri Road was formed around the island.
Another name for Somuuido is 'Temuri'. The name of the west village dock that connects to the footbridge is also called the Temuri dock. The small island with a coastline length of 2.5 km has a history dating back more than 300 years. It is said that Mr. Park's family joined the three daughters and pioneered the island, and Yu Seongseong Village was formed by using Yu as a young man. A lot of shrimp were caught in the vicinity, and at one time, the island was rich enough to have about 40 fishing boats. Somuuido Island was also used as a military logistic base during the Incheon Landing Operation.
On the island, there is a site where the festival was held, and there is also a beach where former President Park Jeong-hee stopped by his family for a recreational car. Around the island, the beach is exposed at low tide. The story of a remote island that even an angler could find would be like this.
Ships and seagulls
From beyond the 414m footbridge, the outline of the Muui sea nuri road made of wooden decks is revealed. The Muui Sea Nuri-gil is divided into eight sections. It takes only an hour to get around the island. If you bring a fishing rod, you can go fishing in the middle of the port in the middle, or sit on a cozy beach and taste lunch.
East village scenery
Via footbridge and west village, it leads to the group. This path, where the natural ecology of Somuui-do remains intact, leads to Dangsan. The Buddha Enlightenment Road was a place where people enjoyed the Pungeo Festival, praying for perfection and safety.
Buddha
Beyond the Buddha's Path, it leads to Mongyeo Beach. Unlike the bustling West Village, it is a way to enjoy the simple port and the beach atmosphere of Mongyeo Beach. You can fish here, but the area around Somuui-do is a hidden point for anglers who catch a lot of fish, sea bass, and surprises. The small size of 250m, Mongyeo Beach is a beach made of sand, white oyster shells, and mongdols.
Mongyeo Beach
Pungeoje site, quiet pine forest road, beach road
If you cross a hill on Mongyeo Beach, it leads to the beach of Myeongsa. This beach is a quiet place where former President Park Chung-hee enjoyed recreation with his family. Haenyeo Island-gil, south of Somuui-do Island, overlooks Haenyeo Island across the sea, and you can see the rock formations along the ridge. Under the beach path and Haenyeo Island Road of Myeongsa, if the water falls during low tide, you can enjoy a coastal trek to the general rock. The legend tells us that pirates saw the shape of a rock and mistook them as generals and soldiers.
Pavilion at the top of Ansan
When you climb the highest mountain on the island (74m), sperm awaits. Here, the scenery around Somuuido Island can be seen at a glance. Yeongheung-do, Jawol-do, and Deokjeok-do were located in the southwest of Somuui-do. Ganghwa-do, Incheon International Airport in the north, Palmido, Incheon Bridge, and Songdo International City in the east lined up. It is time to enjoy the remote scenery of the island and the city at once on a secluded island.
A short pine road
The short pine road in Ansan is the last course of the Muui Sea Nuri Road. If you descend the steep staircase, you will be taken back to the group. After completing a round of the Muui Sea Nuri-gil, the Gentiles enjoy the sea village, eat the conch, go around the alley, or lean the fishing rods at the group's marina, and enjoy the aftertaste of the island village. The relaxing autumn sun feels extraordinarily warm with the family.
Somuui-do Rock Formation

item.title: Jeongseojin, a new memory destination that touches the boat - Seo-gu, Incheon, Korea
item.description:
Species hanging on the sunset wall

Jeongseojin, a new memory destination that touches the boat

Seo-gu, Incheon, Korea

The end is strangely connected with memories. On the extension line of the familiar space, 'the end' creates vague memories. Gangdong's Jeong Dong-jin has long since become a pronoun for making memories, and Jang Heung's Nampo Village's Jeong Nam-jin has also been covered with the story behind the movie <Festival>, increasing the number of people. A new memory spot was created not far from Seoul. This is Jeong Seo-jin, Seo-gu, Incheon.

Jeong Dong-jin and Jeong Nam-jin mean a seaside narrator located in the east and south of the country, starting from Gwanghwamun, Seoul, where former kings lived. Therefore, Jeong Seojin is the end of the Gwanghwamun and the narrator. Jeongseojin coincides with Gwanghwamun's road sign, latitude 37 degrees 34 minutes 08 seconds, toward the west side, and is exactly 34.526 km from Gwanghwamun.

West end of Gwanghwamun, connected to the tidal flat of Yeongjongdo

You may be wondering that Jeong Seo-jin's story has been rising recently. Jeong Seo-jin is connected to the starting point of Gyeongin Ara Waterway. It is a tourist attraction discovered in Seo-gu, Incheon since 2011 in connection with the opening of Gyeongin Ara Waterway. If Jeongdongjin is filled with train stations and wide sandy beaches, and Jeongnamjin has a strong outlook of a secluded fishing village, Jeongseojin looks somewhat unfamiliar with a boat gate and passenger terminal.

If you arrive at Jeong Seo-jin in anticipation of your vague muzzle level, the atmosphere of the neatly refurbished surroundings will approach you. The wind turbines rotating round and round, towering observation decks, and museums that have been remodeled for retirement traps are the first to catch the eye. Below the Yeongjongdaegyo Bridge, the tidal flat spreads out smoothly, and the plane floats and descends over Yeongjongdo. The milestone that informs Jeong Seo-jin is somewhat in between.
Jeongseojin and Yeongjongdaegyo Bridge

The fact that Jeong Seo-jin is still less known in the world can be experienced in local people's message. Even the employees at work and those who came to ride a bicycle on the Arabaetgil have a strange expression on the presence and symbol of Jeong Seo-jin.

Seojin Seo Coverstone
tablet...
The symbolic sculpture of Jeong Seo-jin, who encounters in a large space with a mixture of a square and a marina, is a sunset shaped like a white stone. Noeuljong takes the form of a pebble created by the high and low tide on the west coast. You can see the sunset between the sunset and the sunset when the tide spreads, but this sunset has the meaning of “start” rather than “the end”.
The sunset wall is next to the sunset. The outdoor wall, hanging from a small piece of paper, is an experience space where visitors to Jeongseojin carve memories and new departures.
Sunset
The sunset wall is constructed so that the bell can be hung on the wall containing six themes: love, happiness, hope, excitement, friendship, and romance. It is a scene similar to hanging a lock on a memory spot in the world. The species actually has a variety of writings. The piano engraved on the floor of the sunset wall buzzes various sounds related to the sea.
The writings of the sunset wall
Behind the glow wall, there is a signpost of Jeong Seo-jin in the upper part of the sun, and colorful pinwheels turn behind the Yeongjongdaegyo Bridge.
Poet Jeong Ho-seung sang "Seo-Jin Jin" in a fertilization that stands in a space facing the sea.
Seojin Seo from the observation deck

Friend
Stop tears and come to Jeongseojin
Put your hands on each other's shoulders and tenderly
Look at the red horizon of Jeongseojin, the sunset
How could there be a sunrise without sunset
How can the stars shine without the sun setting?

Wooden deck walkway and wind power generator
Love Story in Jeong Seojin
Jeong Seo-jin's added luck is not only the geographical location, but also the story behind it. Jeong Seo-jin was called 'Jang Moru' in the Goryeo Dynasty. Travelers from the southern region to Gaekyung, the royal road of Goryeo, stayed for a day. At that time, the legend that the son of a grand daughter living in Jeolla-do stayed here in Yeogak (ryokan) as he went to see the past. Based on this legend, Seo-gu Office in Incheon recommends using Jeong Seo-jin as a couple's proposal space or a place to swear love.
Even if you can't see the sunset, there are quite a few places to swear love. Next to the plaza, a wooden deck walkway is formed along the waterway, and beside it, the wind power generator runs beautifully. The Ara Tower observatory overlooks the Arabaetgil and Yeongjongdo tidal flats at a glance.
Hamsang Park
There is a cafe on the upper floor of the observation deck. This café is a bit expensive, but it is the best point to see the most dramatic sunset. The space on the other side is an outdoor deck, and the scenery facing without a window is superior to this.
Ara Tower and Ara Waterway
Hamsang Park and Bicycle Path
Jeong Seo-jin also has small spaces for families, which encourage spring outings. Hamsang Park, which meets on the Arabaetgil, is a space that has been relocated from the marine guards retired after 30 years of active activities. ‘Haekyung 1002 ship’ is a legendary trap that played an active part in the West Sea ferry sinking and the Cheonan ship crew rescue before decommissioning.
The Ara Waterway Exhibition Hall, located on the first floor of Ara Tower, also provides a variety of spaces for real-world experiences. Admission to Hamsang Park, observation deck, and experience hall is free.
Traveling to Jeongseojin is convenient by using the Airport Railroad to Geomam Station. It is connected to Seoul Station, Gongdeok Station, and Hongik University Station, and it can be reached in 20-30 minutes. From Geomam Station, you can transfer by a circular bus. Ara Waterway You can reach Jeongseojin, where the cruise ship is moored, by bicycle. Bicycle rental is also available at Jeongseojin Square. When the sun goes down, a quartet performance will be held at Noeuljong, and the Haenam Festival will be held on the last day of each year.
Tourists riding bicycles

item.title: Yongyu of the aging family is also a fairy tale - Jung-gu, Incheon, Korea
item.description:
Seonyeo Bae Wei-Hyun embraces the sea warmly

Yongyu of the aging family is also a fairy tale

Jung-gu, Incheon, Korea

It is a complicated family. Is it a strange family? Anyway, it is not an ordinary family. <Aging Family> is a film based on the novel of Cheon Myeong-gwan. It is a story of a family member from the middle school age to the grandmother who is 47 years old. Seonnyeo Bae Wei-byeon is the first outing place they left together. Have you seen the sea, grilled clams, and had a glass of soju? On the weekend, you can use the West Sea train.
Island trip around Yongyudo
Also, grill the meat. Han-soo, the eldest son of Baeksu-gundal, an unsuccessful filmmaker In-mo, Mi-yeon decides to divorce, and her junior high school daughter Min-kyung. A 69-year-old mother has been grilling meat every day since five families gathered. Did you have a little soju? The eldest son takes out a vague old story. It is a memory of Changgyeongwon family outing as a child. The cherry blossoms are flying, the meat is ripening, the youngest daughter Miyeon is singing and singing, and the second mother-in-law is reading and reading (?), And the mood is good. It was a time when the family became aging now. At that time, the mother, who only smiled and grilled meat, immediately proposed.
“Let's go, picnic. My mom also wants to go. ”
That...
“Eulwangni Beach.”
Eulwangni Beach is the western edge of Yeongjongdo. It goes up north along the beach, followed by Seonnyeo Baeui Beach, Eulwangni Beach, and Wangsan Beach. If you go further south, it is Muuido Island. In the summer of last year, SBS entertainment program <Running Man> was filmed here. Muuido Island connects Silmido Island to the north and Somuuido Island to the south. Somuuido has a small “small”, but it cannot be confined to its meaning. It has been the center of Muuido for a long time, and people have lived since 300 years ago. Muuido, a large island, was a ranch until the end of Joseon. A bridge was laid in 2011 between Somuuido Island and Muuido Island, and now it is a walking distance.
The road of Muui sea that goes around Somuuido is also spotlighted. The length is about 2.5km, and it is enough for an hour to walk by turtle. You have the pleasure of walking slowly through the island where you can't even hear the sound of a car engine. It is also romantic to look at the sea scenery under your feet from the pavilion of Ansan, the summit of the island. You can also see airplanes flying from and to Incheon International Airport. It is not too far from the land. I haven't heard a lot of word-of-mouth yet, so I enjoy a leisurely island trip.
On the other hand, Silmido in the north of Muuido Island is as famous as the movie title. Silmi Beach is a perfect place for the summer. Muido Island forms a double wall with Hana Beach on the main island. In Mui-do, Horyonggoksan is also a famous spot. You can embrace a wide view by light hiking. There are three islands, Modo, Shindo, and Shido, on the north side of Mui Island with Yeongjongdo in between. It leads to the bridge, aka Samhyungseom Island. There are drama shooting sets such as <Sad Love Story> and <Full House>. Baemikkumi Sculpture Park is very interesting in Modo, the very first island. Strange sculptures color the edge of the beach. Along with Yeongjongdo's beach, it is an island suitable for a day trip.
Nearby shops and residential districts seen from Seonnyeo Bayou
The love of a fairy who embraces a rock
In Yeongjong-do, a promenade was opened along the coast of Yongyu. From Geojampo in the south, it passes through the Maanian Beach and continues to Seonnyeo Rock, Eulwangri, and Wangsan Beach. It is a 1-hour course from Geojampo to Macian Beach, a 2-hour drive from Macian to Seonyeo Baeui Beach, and a 3-hour course from Seonyeo Baeui Beach to Eulwangri and Wangsan Beach. It is advisable to step in time to find the tide on an autumn day when the summer heat is gone.
Among these beaches, the place that <Aging Family> found is the winter sea of Seonyeo Bai Wei. In the play, Miyeon's boyfriend confidently said 'Eulwang-ri', but the shape of the fairy-tale rock is clearly captured at the end of the sandy beach where the family arrived due to his controversy. Hagiya also belongs to Eulwangri (dong). The first child in the family to run toward the sea is a mother-in-law. He is 44 years old. However, the first word of the mother who suggested the outing is very realistic.
"cold. Just go. ”
Min-kyung, a granddaughter and daughter, is an adult. She leads her grandmother's hand and the gear goes to the white sand. Only then did the rest of the family move slowly towards the sea. Han-mo and Mi-yeon's boyfriend wrestle, and then the whole family entangled in the sand. It is full of cool smiles. It is a happy time for the aging family. It is no different from any other family. Family photos are also taken with a cell phone. Everyone laughs brightly. In the distant Balchi, the rock of the fairy is grown up. Because of the high tide, the rock of the sea disappeared and the lonely rock on the sea was lonely.
Eulwang-Lina and Seonnyeo Rock, creating a different landscape from Wangsan
Seonnyeo Rock is a rock that stands like a tower when viewed from a distance. But as you get closer, the image resembling the name is revealed. It is a rock that the fairies came down and played on a rainbow. There are other legends. A fairy tale, who was driven out of the anger of the Jade Emperor, met a rock bachelor and married. One year later, the Jade Emperor called the fairy again, but when he rebelled, he thundered. Even if they died, they didn't know that they would fall together. In the end, it is said that it became a rock of one body while standing. If you look closely, you can see the fairy holding the rock tightly. It is also said that the fairy tale rock strengthens the relationship between the couple or the couple.
It is impressive that the fairy seems to have embraced the rock.
Family members are different. In fact, the tidal flat experience is possible because there is a large difference between the tide and the seaside. There are many who are looking for a family outing. At low tide, the sea rocks are lush. It is like a fairy and a child of a rock, and it surrounds the sheep. The white sandy beach that embraces the sea is also beautiful. If you can afford it, you can stay a little late. The reason why lovers often visit is because they can be easily moved from Seoul, and in addition, the beautiful sunset of the West Sea creates a romantic atmosphere. In the drama <Boys over Flowers>, the place where Joo Jun-pyo (Lee Min-ho) confessed his love to the golden grass (Koo Hye-seon) and kissed him for the first time, also in the drama <Gold me out!> The scene recalling the past day with Kim Da-hyun) is also the sea that is the background of a beautiful relationship in the play.
Looking from behind the fairy rock looks like a bear
Take the train to the sea!
By the end of August this year, accessibility is also good. This is because the West Sea train runs every weekend.
Many people come to the tidal flat experience as a family unit
On weekdays, you need to get off the bus at Incheon International Airport. However, the West Sea train runs one more stop at Incheon International Airport Station and stops at Yongyu Temporary Station. It is an hour and 10 minutes from Seoul Station. You can also take it from Hongik University Station, Digital Media City Station, and Gimpo Airport Station. The transportation is convenient, but the scenery of the sea off the coast of Incheon, seen through a large window, is spectacular.
A family walking toward the sea like a scene from <Aging Family>
There is Jamjindo Pier near Yongyu Temporary Station. This is where the boat to Muuido starts.
Flocks of seagulls add a sea vibe to the beach or from the sky
Macian Beach is also a boon. It is a sea where white sand beaches and sea pines harmonize. You can enjoy light leisure as well as tidal flat experience. Yongsan-do Beach and Seonyeo Baeui Beach run north from Macian Beach. Bus 202 comes and goes about 7 km away.
The panoramic view of the white sandy beach that is in the sky is beautiful
In Eulwangri, shellfish grilling is an indispensable delicacy. It does not fall into a drama or movie set in the background, and it stimulates my taste. <Aging family> is no exception. It is a family that likes to eat and drink. However, putting cold water in a pleasant picnic meeting atmosphere will eventually be a drink. Mi-yeon, who sacrificed for her brother's back pants, heads for her mother. The fight spreads to the side table where the gear has nothing to do with it. At that moment, the aging family is reunited. Mi-in's mother-in-law also has a family relationship. A word he threw brings a warm smile.
“My dear brother… . ”
The West Sea train has a great view of the sea from the window.
The last scene is again the winter sea. Mother and mother are side by side. The mother asks and answers.
“When was the happiest time you ever lived? I? Well. There are too many to point out. ”
Gatbawi Rock is located between Seonnyeo Rock and the sandy beach.
Perhaps in her memory, there was also an outing for a fairy tale. Occasionally, you may have looked back at family photos left on your phone and recalled pleasant memories. As she said, it's nothing like a family. Gather together, eat together, sleep together, cry together and laugh, that's a family.
The sunset toward Eulwangni Beach is also excellent, but the island's shadow is also beautiful.
Perhaps the fairy who hugged the rock surely realized it only after she became a man.
Flock of seagulls flying leisurely

Weekday: Get off at Incheon Airport Station on the Airport Railroad, transfer to bus # 302 at Platform 2 on the 3rd floor, and get off at Seonnyeo Baeui

item.title: Meet the history of Ganghwado in one place, Ganghwado Ganghwa History Museum - Ganghwa-gun, Incheon, Korea
item.description:
Ganghwa History Museum

Meet the history of Ganghwado in one place, Ganghwado Ganghwa History Museum

Ganghwa-gun, Incheon, Korea

Ganghwa Island, the fourth largest island in Korea. Although it is an island, it is not only a place in the metropolitan area, but also an easy way to cross Ganghwa Bridge or Choji Bridge. Ganghwado is a town with a variety of history from prehistoric times to modern times. The Ganghwa History Museum, where you can get a glimpse of Ganghwa Island's breathtaking history, is a place to visit before you go on a trip to Ganghwa Island, and is a space to enrich your trip to Ganghwa Island.

From prehistoric times to old sayings, where Ganghwa has a history
Ganghwa-do is a perfect place for exploring cultural heritage. It is not an exaggeration to say that the island itself is the birthplace of history. A variety of history is piled up from prehistoric times to Goryeo and Joseon periods. The ruins of the dolmen in Ganghwa-do were listed as UNESCO World Heritage Sites along with Hwasun in Jeollanam-do and Gochang in Jeollabuk-do. Ganghwa History Museum, located inside Ganghwa Dolmen Park, is a place where you can take a quick look at the history of Ganghwa Island, so it is the first place to visit before going on a trip to Ganghwa Island.
The old Ganghwa History Museum was located in Gapgot Dondae, where you meet as soon as you cross Ganghwa Bridge. After looking around the history building, it was a textbook course on a tour of excursions that toured the scenes of the western powers of the western powers in the late Joseon Dynasty, such as Gwangseongbo, Deokjinjin, and Chojijin. However, it is true that the size of the history hall is small, so it is not only impossible to see all the history of Ganghwa Island at a glance, but it has also been an exploration tour that is biased toward modern history.
2nd floor permanent exhibition room
Ganghwa History Museum was expanded and moved to Dolmen Park in 2010. The Ganghwa History Museum, which consists of two floors, goes directly up to the second floor from the ticket counter on the first floor, first looks around the prehistoric period, then descends to the first floor and meets Goryeo and Joseon periods in turn.
Ganghwa History Museum

The second floor of the museum displays prehistoric artifacts from the Old Stone Age to the Bronze Age. This is a great place for children to experience and learn the history of Ganghwa, including exploring the exciting Bronze Age and talking about the open sea of Ganghwa. In the exciting Bronze Age exploration, you can solve quizzes and puzzles on the screen, and there is also a photo zone where you can take a commemorative photo with the fairy of the Chamseongdan. Ganghwa's open sea story tells a shadow play. It contains the story of a Ganghwa young man who needs to send Goryeo celadon to the Philippines through the sea route. In addition, various stories that have been handed down to Ganghwa, such as Orunji Mountain of Goryeo Mountain, Jeondeungsa Temple, Nannasang, Sondol, and Bomunsa Seoksil Nahansang, are briefly composed and fun to read.

‘Explore the exciting Bronze Age’ experience space
Ganghwa-do meets the history of suffering
On the first floor of the Ganghwa History Museum, you can meet various relics and historical events from the Goryeo Dynasty to the Joseon Dynasty. At the end of the Joseon Dynasty, the frequent invasion of the western powers caused the Ganghwa Island to be thoroughly devastated.
Diorama reproducing Byeongin Yangyo
Byung In Yang Yoo was a case of French invasion of the persecution of Catholicism, and Shin Mi Yang Yoo was a case of the US invasion of the burning General Sherman in the Daedong River. Although the country and the reason for the invasion are different, Byeongin Yang and Shin Mi Yang are similar in many ways. In addition to the commonality of the imperial aggression of the Western powers, the process of looting and retrieval is exactly alike. France retreated and plundered the Uigwejangs and old books of the Joseon Dynasty, and the United States took General Suh Jae-gi, the longevity of General Jae-yeon Eo, as a loot. The Uigyu Janggak Uigui of the Joseon Dynasty stepped on the land of the homeland in 145 years in 2011, and Sujagi returned to the homeland of 2007 in 136 years. Needless to say, it is a joy that has been returned, but the sad history of the sad and dismal Joseon of Joseon is hidden behind the hidden side.
Diorama recreating new beauty
A diorama that reproduces the scene of the French army invading Ganghwa during Byeonginyangyo and the battle between the U.S. military and Joseon troops in Gwangseongbo during Shinmiyangyo can give a glimpse of the situation at that time. In particular, life-size hand-crafts are hung on the diorama that reproduces the new beauty, and regret and cross meet.
Along with the new beauty diorama, it is hanging

Along the coastline of Ganghwa Island, there are military facilities in the Joseon Dynasty called Jin, Bo, and Dondae. Hyojong, the Joseon Dynasty, who carved the disgrace of Byeongja Horan on his chest, began to install it as one of the North Korean punishment plans. Among them, Chojijin, Deokjinjin, and Gwangseong were the places where fierce battles took place in 1871 (8th year of King Gojong). The power of the cannon shooting from the ship was so great that it could not be matched by the ship's canvas. The next day after giving out the earthquake, Deokjinjin and Gwangseongbo fell. Around 1000 Korean troops under General Eo Jae-yeon were killed, except for a few who could not have been misled. Sujagi, which was placed on the camp of the Joseon army, was replaced with stars and stripes. If you look at the miserable photos of Shin Mi Yang Yoo, you will become a performer. Even today, the remains of the shells remained on the walls and pine trees of Chojijin.

Super earthquake wall with traces of shells
Chojijin is an indispensable course on the excursion to Deokjinjin and Gwangseongbo along with the history of Ganghwa Island. It is also a good idea to walk on the 2nd course of Ganghwa Nadeulgil from Gapgot Dondae to Chojijin (17km).
Gwangseongbo, where the hand-to-hand battle took place at the time of Shin Mi Yangyo
Meet the most beautiful dolmen in Korea

The outside of Ganghwa History Museum is Dolmen Park. Dolmen is a representative tomb of the Bronze Age and is a cultural heritage representing the megalithic culture of the world. The dolmen named ‘Standing Stone’ is often referred to as Jiseokmyo. There are more than 30,000 dolmens in Korea alone, and if you add up to 30,000 dolmens in North Korea, it is a dolmen kingdom. It is no wonder that the dolmen ruins of Ganghwa Island, along with Gochang in Jeonbuk and Hwasun in Jeonnam, were registered as UNESCO World Heritage Sites in 2000.

In Ganghwa Island, more than 100 dolmens are scattered mainly at the foot of Goryeo Mountain. It's not much compared to the dolmens in Gochang or Hwasun, but it comes to mind first when it comes to the image of dolmens. It is called dolmen in the vicinity. This dolmen is a typical drum-style dolmen that is covered with two stones. It looks like a table and is called a table-type dolmen, but it is a grand dolmen with a height of 2.5m and a cover stone of 50 tons.
The dolmen is largely divided into a table type, a checkerboard type, and an open seat type. Among them, the table-style dolmen is a dolmen where the grave room is exposed on the ground. As a result, table-style dolmens are prone to robbery and damage over the years. Nowadays, the dolmen in the vicinity is composed of 2 goimdols and 1 shroud, but it is thought that it was originally a tomb room made of 4 goimdols and covered with a shroud. It is a dolmen that has been robbed and damaged over the years, leaving only empty shells. Whatever the reason, the dolmens in the vicinity of the neighborhood are majestic like a general full of dignity, which is impeccable even when looking around. The nearby dolmens are designated as historical sites No. 137 in the name of Jiseokmyo in the vicinity of Ganghwa.

Dolmen near Ganghwa

item.title: Fun to see, fun to eat Specialty bread meet at Incheon attractions - Jung-gu, Incheon, Korea
item.description:
Sorae Historic Site, Sorae History Museum

Fun to see, fun to eat Specialty bread meet at Incheon attractions

Jung-gu, Incheon, Korea

Incheon is the birthplace of Jajangmyeon and Myeonmyeon, a national menu that everyone can enjoy. The geographic advantage of facing the sea and the historical characteristics of the road leading to the entrance of modern civilization during the opening of the port are combined, so the food is unique and rich. sign
It contains real snow crab, soraepogu snow crab bread
Sorae Port, where the memories of the Suin Line narrow gauge train remain. Nowadays, it is more famous as a fish market that is full of aquatic products such as blue crab, shrimp, and salted fish. Sorae Pogu Traditional Fish Market is always full of vitality thanks to the strong voices of the merchants selling fresh seasonal seafood and goods. You can also sit on one side of the marina and eat it after you eat it in the market. Near the fish market is Sorae History Museum, which shows the history of Sorae.
If you've toured the Sorae Pogu Fish Market and Sorae History Museum, it's time to taste the Sorae Pogu specialty bread. On the 1st floor of the Sorae Pogu Fish Market building next to the Sorae History Museum, where there is a narrow gauge train, there is a shop called 'Uljin Daege Bread'. Uljin Snow Crab is located in Sorae Pogu, so it's easy to think of it as a chain store, but surprisingly, this is the main store. The owner of Uljin's hometown, the first crab crab in Uljin, is now headquartered in Soraepogu. The store in Hupo Port, Uljin is a direct store. Sorae Pogu without going to Uljin far, it is also good because you can taste snow crab bread at the main store.
'Uljin Snow Crab' is located right next to Sorae History Museum
If you think that the snow crab bread is just a snow crab shaped bread, like the taiyaki bread, the koi bread, and the chrysanthemum bread, it's misleading. Taiyaki bread does not contain guppy, but crab crab actually contains crab meat. Before you try the taste of bread with snow crab
Snow crab bread with red bean paste and snow crab
Put the red bean paste on the dough mixed with Uljin snow crab powder and snow crab, and bake it in a snow crab mold. The baking method is the same as that of Taiyaki, but the taste is very different. You can feel the crab taste by biting the freshly baked snow crab bread. It is also possible to feel the familiar 'shrimp' taste. Sue
Snow crab bread with red bean paste and snow crab
The transformation of snow crab bread does not end here. It also sells snow crab bread with blueberries and snow crab bread sandwiches cut with a mixture of snow crab flour.
Unusual sandwich made of snow crab
Stars as popular as Jjajangmyeon, Chinatown Onggi and Hongdu
Incheon Chinatown with reddish colors. The signboard in Chinese characters and the Chinese heard here and there are similar, and it makes you feel like you are in China. After the opening of Incheon Port in 1883, the following year, Cheongguk Jogyoji was established. It is the beginning of Incheon China Town. Chinatown was built as Chinese people built Chinese-style houses and dominated the commercial area. In the past, retail stores that handle a variety of Chinese products mainly dominated, but now most Chinese restaurants. As the place where Jajangmyeon was born for the first time in Korea, it is crowded with tourists who want to taste Jajangmyeon and various Chinese food on weekends. When you enter the main street of Chinatown, you often see people lined up in long lines.
More gorgeous Chinatown scenery at night
Onggibyeong is one of the most popular food items in Chinatown today. It is baked in a large pot shaped like a pot, so it is also called a pot-shaped dumpling in Korea.
Onggi before entering the furnace
Although they are called dumplings by adding beef such as minced meat and vegetables in the dough, they have a completely different shape and texture from ordinary dumplings.
A pot that looks like a pot for baking pottery
It is like a bread because it is baked on the wall of a fire pottery pot. The outside is crispy and the inside is chewy. Depending on the ingredients inside, you can taste four types of Onggi, such as meat, sweet potato, sweet pumpkin, and red beans.
A hot pot of rice cooked in the oven
Hong Du-Byeong is the new star that has emerged as a popular snack in Chinatown along with Onggi. Roast a lot of sweet cows such as red beans, mango, cream cheese, and dark chocolate in the dough. You may think, “Why is it Japanese-style Imagawa-yaki in Chinatown?” But as you can see from the border staircase of the Cheongil Jogyeji Temple, looking back at the history of Chinatown where Chinese and Japanese culture coexisted,
Red bean disease with plenty of sweet cow
The snack street is like a fairy tale, Songwol-dong Fairy Tale Village Dolphin Pizza
A short walk from Chinatown brings you to Songwol-dong Fairy Tale Village. Unlike Chinatown, which was a reddish heaven and earth, the colorful scenery unfolds. Unlike many mural villages across the country, the feature is that it is decorated with the theme of “fairy tale”. Fairy-tale heroes, such as Snow White, Cinderella, Hansel and Gretel, and Wizards of Oz, are accustomed to everyone in the village. The fairy-tale scenery that fills the residential area arouses conscience not only for children but also for adults.
Songwol-dong Fairy Tale Village Scenery
As you walk through Donghwa Village, you will encounter some snacks. Among them, 'Dolphin Pizza', which goes well with the concept of Donghwa Village, stands out. Dolphin Pizza shop is located on the hillside overlooking Donghwa Village. Dolphins with a three-dimensional feel as if they are about to pop out of the spot are occupying the center of the signboard.
Dolphin pizza shop decorated with the theme of dolphins
Originally, this place had an old house decorated with dolphins. According to President Song Wol-dong, the native president, even if the old building is demolished and rebuilt, the theme of the site should remain the same. So the building was newly built, but the dolphin theme was saved.
Dolphin-shaped bread frame developed by you
Instead of just decorating the building with dolphins, we went one step further and developed a dolphin-shaped pizza. We made a dolphin bread frame and combined pizza, a menu that everyone, men and women, can enjoy together. Dolphin Pizza, a snack suitable for Donghwa Village, was born.
Dolphin Pizza
Put the dough in a dolphin-shaped bread mold and put the stuffing such as cheese into it. The appearance is similar to that of Taiyaki, and the taste is similar to that of pizza. You can choose between bulgogi flavor and corn cheese flavor.
Dolphin Pizza
Travel information

Nearby destinations

http://bkcrab.co.kr/

item.title: [Day Trip to Island] To you who have forgotten summer, Trekking Heaven Jangbongdo - Ongjin-gun, Incheon, Korea
item.description:
The sunset seen from the dried fishery beach

[Day Trip to Island] To you who have forgotten summer, Trekking Heaven Jangbongdo

Ongjin-gun, Incheon, Korea

Large and small peaks stood on the sea. Haemu came in and wrapped around comfortably. Gaetti-gil along the ridge has a fresh summer scent. Every time a blade of grass grazes the ankle, the cicadas are rumbling. I stopped walking for a moment and wiped the sweat from my forehead. I sat on a rock and watched the plane take off from Yeongjongdo Island and drank ice water. So I learned how to fly in Jangbongdo in the summer.
A light day trip to the island
Although travel is an everyday age, island travel still leads to the field of enthusiasts. This is because it takes a long time to reach the granularity, making it difficult to travel on a day, and there are many unpredictable variables due to the isolated environment.
Tourist information center, cafe, and tourist center
Nevertheless, the one-day island tour has been actively conducted around Incheon Ongjin-gun. Shin, Si, Modo, Jangbongdo, and Muuidodo, which are close to Yeongjongdo, are typical.
Seagull yawning near the dock
Among them, Jangbong-do is famous for a day-trip trekking spot. The name means `` island with long peaks, '' but there are seven trekking courses along the ridge and coast. Each course has different charms and features, including a fresh course on the 1st course from the marina to the middle of the island, as well as the sky path, the road beyond Gugi, the road to Jangbong Coast, the road to Yadal Mermaid, the path to Handeul Coast, and the path to Jangbong Treasure.
A small rocky island in front of Ongam Village.
Except for the 1st and 2nd courses across the central part of the island, they are all coastal walks along the sea. The sea seen from here is incredibly clean and blue, not to be believed to be the West Sea. At this time, most of the daytime, more of the low tide and tidal flats are revealed, but even this is just beautiful. The sandy tidal flat where the tidal flat meets the tidal rock is called ‘Got Tea’. This is the reason why the name “Got Ti-gil” was named on the trekking course of Jangbong-do.
It is called a remote place because it cannot go as far as it is near.
Twenty-five (one-way) flights a day also allow for a one-day trip. From Yeongjongdo Sammok Wharf, there are one or two ships heading to Jangbong-do almost every hour from 7:10 am to 8:40 pm. It takes about 40 minutes to depart from Sammok and arrive at Jangbongdo via Shindo. Passenger cars and freight cars are also available. Detailed timetable Sejong Shipping 과 Hallym Shipping You can check it on the homepage.
Heading towards the head of a path along the skyway
Trekking in the heat-in search of the head
The first place people visit in Jangbongdo is the tourist center located near the marina.
City bus waiting in front of the marina
Beginners usually ask for directions. Maps detailing the trekking course are not available online, so you will often receive a brochure or advice.
The terminal stop is the starting point of the Jangbong Coastal Road.
When you ask the staff about the ‘most popular course’, you will be introduced to the 2nd course of the course and the 4th course of the Jangbong Coast.
The way to the head.
Most people take the village bus from the marina and get off at the final stop, Chukdong (Jangbong 4-ri / Geoneojang Beach), and then walk along the Jangbong Coastal Road to Gamakmeori, the western end of the island.
Green forest path and stairs
When you return, you follow the ridge path, Heavenly Path, to Jinchon (Jangbong 3-ri), opposite the axis. This is a 3 hour and 30 minute course. You have to make a choice here.
It passes through the ridge road that touches the sky. (Skyway)
If you want to go back to the marina by using the town bus, you need to go a little further to the starting point, Chuk-dong, and if you want to lack momentum, you can continue trekking along the fresh course of Course 1, which leads to the marina. In this case, it takes 6-7 hours.
Pyeongchon (Jangbong 2-ri) seen from Bonghwadae.
Many people are famous for their beautiful sunsets. On the left side of the observatory, you can see the twin uninhabited islands of Seomando and Dongmando side by side. In winter, the sun falls exactly between the two islands. Wherever it goes, it's every thing that you're ecstatic. However, if you do not have specialized equipment such as lanterns, you must hurry up Hassan.
Gamagori Observatory
Observation deck ban is forbidden, so if you spend your time, you will wander in the dark. There are many sunset points around the village, such as the dried fish beach and Yadal dock, so there is no need to be sad.
Stamp post installed on the observation deck.

A trekking paradise is not a smooth road. There are few decks or stairs and most of them are made of dirt and rocks, which can be difficult for those unfamiliar with climbing. In addition, grass and trees are lush when there is a shower in the summer, making some areas uncomfortable. The fresh play path and the sky path (under difficulty) stretching along the main ridgeline are relatively wide and flat, but the Jangbong Coastal Path (on difficulty level) is narrow and rough, so it is recommended to avoid trekking beginners as much as possible. Even if it is not a coastal road, keep in mind that Jangbongdo itself has long ridges and repeats the uphill and downhill paths, so it is easy to get tired even if the course is short.

A panoramic view of Jangbongdo Island from the Bonghwadae. It looks like a long mountain peak.
Jangbongdo's Hidden Treasure
① Beach with tidal flats
There are 5 beaches in Jangbong-do. Ongam Beach, the closest to the marina, is a representative tourist attraction with various restaurants and convenient facilities. On weekends, camping crowds are so crowded that the field is filled with tents. The wide tidal flat is a playground for children to play freely. 뙤 It's busy picking up shellfish or crabs without worrying about the sun. Jangbongdo is a mudflat everywhere. In the distant sea, there are several places of grass. In some places, the depths are deep and the water is fast. It was called the golden fishing ground from the Joseon Dynasty for a good reason.
Quiet and quiet weekday afternoon Ongam Beach
There are also mermaid legends related to abundant fishery resources. The fisherman Choi Choi, who hit the ball every day, was delighted to find a mermaid caught in the net one day, but the eyes seemed so sad that he put it back to the sea, and since then, every time a fisherman throws a net, a fish is caught. In fact, you can meet a mermaid statue built at the dock in Jangbongdo to remember the mermaid's boeun.
Sister picking something up from tidal flat
② Delicious seafood
Sanghap, Sora, and clams are seafood representing Jangbongdo. The elderly in the village go out near the grass and offshore in small streets to catch up. Mussels are lilies belonging to the most expensive species of shellfish. It is caught a lot in the nearby tidal flats, but the bigger and better the competition is, the farther it goes out to sea. Sora is the same. It comes from the tidal flats and from the sea, and the mussel is bigger and tastes better. The collected sashimi is purchased at the village restaurant. Mussels and clams are kalguksu, and sora is served in bibimbap.
Sorbibimbap at the “Sky Garden” restaurant, which boasts a colorful color
Sora Bibimbap, jointly developed by Incheon City and Cheongwoon University, is a representative menu of Jangbongdo. The fat seashell was full. Even the first chapter contains the philosophy and spirit of the food maker. The ‘Sky Garden’ plant is sweet and not spicy with apples, plums, and pears. For customers who don't have a good stomach, they make instant soy sauce.
Adult palm size
After trekking and feeling the nature and taste of Jangbong-do, the day and night quickly stop. The last boat to Yeongjongdo Sammok Wharf is 9:20 PM. When I return to 뭍, I feel like I was in a different world today. 1 hour 30 minutes from Seoul. There is a magical world that makes hot air forget this near.
Sanghap Kalguksu with a light and rich taste

item.title: Rediscovering old buildings that shine as they get older, analog walks at Incheon Port - Jung-gu, Incheon, Korea
item.description:
Café spot, designated as a modern cultural heritage

Rediscovering old buildings that shine as they get older, analog walks at Incheon Port

Jung-gu, Incheon, Korea

Next to the bustling Chinatown, Incheon Open Port Modern History and Culture Town has a history of more than 130 years after opening. Compared to Chinatown, spaces that resemble black and white photographs seem to be hidden in the more leisurely streets. I found a space that has been reborn as a sensuous cafe or gallery by recycling buildings that have been lit up with traces of time. Let's walk through the faded time.
Reborn of a 100-year-old wooden house, cafe pot
When you go to the Incheon Jung-gu Office, the Japanese wooden houses create an exotic scenery. It is a painful trace of the looting after the opening of Incheon in 1883, but the scenery in which Chinatown and Japanese buildings are clearly divided is distinctive. In the streets of old churches, cafes, and museums, the buildings bearing the sign of 'Korea Modern Cultural Heritage' stand out. It is a cafe pot that has entered a 3-story wooden house for over 100 years. On weekends, it is always crowded with people looking for red bean porridge and red bean shaved ice.
Baek Young-im, who has been a citizen cultural movement in Incheon, opened a cafe here because of the value of architecture. This building was an office and a lodging company for over 100 Korean workers in Japan. After liberation, it was used for various purposes such as herbal medicine, Nonghyup, and newspapers. As it was revealed that the building was built between the late 1880s and the early 1890s, the white sand beach was examined with expert advice to see if it was worth preserving. As far as the record goes, there have been no cases where three-storey Japanese-style combined use houses remain intact. The interior structure was made as long as possible and hung on the restoration work for a long time.
Window seat facing the open port street
"I think it's better to keep what is left than to make it new. It was a pity that modern buildings in Incheon disappeared before they even announced their value. Even if it was restored, I hoped that it would be a cafe where people can come and go more easily than a space stuffed with history. I did it. "
In the following year, Fatal was designated as a registered cultural property No. 567 in recognition of its architectural value.
Myeongdang of Fatal connected to the outside garden
Inside the cafe, there is an old-fashioned atmosphere. Hand-held accessories, such as a wooden ceiling exposed in the old way, a small garden in the back yard, a table using a sewing machine used by my mother, and a phone made in 1918, matched nicely. Postcards and brochures are displayed at the entrance of the cafe where you can see the port opening season. On the 2nd to 3rd floor, there is a tatami room operated by reservation system.
2nd floor tatami room with black and white photos
Patal's representative menu is Nagasaki Castella, which is baked with plenty of red bean porridge made from domestic red beans, red bean ice water, and honey. There are many customers who visit the cafeteria near the school and remember the taste of red bean porridge that they bought and bought five times ago. Along with sweet red bean porridge, there are many customers who visit red bean shaved ice, which is sold only for 100 bowls a day on weekends, and castella, which was a gift for weddings in the 1960s and 1970s.
Sweet red bean porridge with chewy injeolmi and cinnamon scent
Ganghwa-do glutinous rice and glutinous rice cake made from domestic red beans are good to serve with black tea.
Glutinous rice cake made in a cooperative made up of local bakeries in Incheon
Gwandong Gallery, a house with a 90-year-old tree fragrance
From Fatal, enter Incheon Jung-gu Office and enter the alley on the left, leading to the Kwandong Gallery. After the opening, consulates and police stations were concentrated in this area. There were many government offices, so it was named Kanto. Named after the region, the Kwandong Gallery opens a unique exhibition by taking advantage of the regional characteristics of the cultural junction between Korea, China and Japan.
Current status of Kwandong Gallery

Traces of more than 90 years old are hidden in various places around the small exhibition hall. It is the couple of Ikuko Toda and photographer Eun-Gyu Ryu, who inadvertently breathe new life into an old house that might be overlooked, who went on a study abroad trip to Korea more than 30 years ago. In the Kanto region, which was a Japanese concession, there are Japanese town houses in the form of 'Machiya'. Kwandong Gallery is one of them. When viewed from outside the building, six two-storey buildings are placed side by side, and it is an unusual townhouse with a common courtyard behind the building.

"The house lives longer than people. From the 1920s to the 1930s, many people have gone through this house. Every time I tear off the ceiling and find a hidden space, I feel like breathing with a long time. It's a pleasure that you can't enjoy in an apartment. . "

Gwandong Gallery before construction
The attic provided on the second floor of the exhibition hall is a space where you can feel the excitement of reproduction. During the work of dismantling the ceiling, I found that the girder was connected from next door to next door. The secret space, which had been hiding for nearly 90 years, was renovated into a loft library where anyone can sit and read books after a minimal fee.
2nd floor exhibition hall and attic to guess the age of the building
Most of them are modern history books of Korea, China, and Japan, collections of photos, and books related to art. The more you look back and forth, the more attractive it is to see the invisible place and the charm of the wooden architecture and the sense of modern recycling of the old space. It is the result of revealing and utilizing the old and flawed parts rather than covering them.
2nd floor exhibition hall and attic to guess the age of the building
There is a bright space behind the prop shop on the first floor. This is a drawing room and guest room that has been converted from an old kitchen.
Reception room and guest room
Walls with peeling paint, old water pipes, and windows facing a 100-year-old stone wall seem to have a long story.
Reception room and guest room
The accessory shop on the first floor is full of vintage objects from various regions such as Japan, China, and Zimbabwe. Even the props, such as a 100-year-old travel bag and old wooden dolls, that the enema couples had directly obtained from Yanbian, resemble this space.
When entering the gallery, the first prop shop that greets you

item.title: A trip to September, with trees, and Incheon Grand Park Wood Culture Experience Center Mokyeon-ri - Namdong-gu, Incheon, Korea
item.description:
World Architecture Award and Red Dot Design Award Main Prize

A trip to September, with trees, and Incheon Grand Park Wood Culture Experience Center Mokyeon-ri

Namdong-gu, Incheon, Korea

I have a carpenter friend. When asked about the merits of work, the answer is, "I can touch the tree." I also like to touch trees. The texture of the wood is 'emotional' compared to other objects. Not smooth but calm While living in wood, even after dying in furniture and books. So when you touch a tree, 'good' and 'reliable' are pushed to one side of your heart.

#Woodworking experience # Mokyeon-ri #Incheon Arboretum #Incheon Arboretum #Attractions #Amazing Dating #September Travel #Nagolo Walking #Half Day Family Outing #Design Tour #Art Tour #Architecture #World Architecture Awards #Red Dot Design Award #Ecology learning

On a clear autumn day, I went to Incheon to touch the trees. There are many wood culture experience places. But why is it Incheon? Mokyeon-ri, a wooden cultural experience center in Incheon Grand Park, is a special place. One huge design.
Incheon Grand Park Wood Culture Experience Center
Unlike the existing timber culture center, it is a modern exposed concrete building. Special wooden devices also give life to the body. Or is it the World Architecture Community (WAC) World Architecture Award and the Red Dot Design Award Concept? The name of the grand park, the zelkova tunnel, the buckwheat blossoms and the cosmos under the ground can also make you flutter.
1st floor ambience wall
Make Dad and Mom Together: With Family
Mokyeon-ri, Incheon Grand Park Wood Culture Experience Center, is a two-story building. On the first floor, there is a ginkgo workshop used by elementary school students and adults. The zelkova workshop on the second floor has a family. Children make their parents, cloud-shaped plates, planes, and so on. Although it is at the level of duke, the imagination of the filmmaker's hand is rough.
Incheon Grand Park Wood Culture Experience Center Mokyeon-ri
Next to the zelkova workshop on the 2nd floor is the Cloud Playground. It is full of wooden toys such as tool play and train play. The pool full of cypress balls is especially popular. It's a phytoncide playground. The lobby on the second floor is rich in wood, due to the tight planks on the ceiling.
Incheon Arboretum Promenade
You may want to give the children an explanation of a tree like a cypress ball pool.
Cloud Playground Cypress Ball Pool
There is a nail and sawing experience in the lobby on the first floor. If you drop by, it's worth a try. There is an angel wing photo zone on the entrance wall of the building. Wood Experience Center Mokyeon-ri is adjacent to Incheon Arboretum. It is a good size for a light walk with children. If you want to visit the grand park together, the southern wetlands, pampas grass, and infant forest experience center are suitable for autumn ecological learning.
Ginkgo workshop woodwork experience for elementary school students and adults
Like a tree if you love: with a lover or friend
Ginkgo workshop on the first floor is perfect when you're with a lover or a friend. Make living supplies such as wooden speakers, mini-shops, and reading stands. It is a form of assembling wooden boards prepared in advance, but the process of touching and pasting wood is more interesting than you think. Sometimes they come in loved ones or friends and make each other's gifts.
To relax and enjoy Mokyeon-ri's architecture, head to the outdoor deck shelter next to the 2nd Floor Cloud Playground. Corresponds to the inside of the triangle's acute angle. In the circumference, a wooden board shaped like '∧' is stacked to form a screen. In the meantime, relax and enjoy the view of Incheon Grand Park or Arboretum. Floor patterns vary when shadows are cast. Carpentry experiences are scheduled for both workshops twice a week and three weekends. The experience fee (excluding material cost) is inexpensive at 2000-3000 won.
Pin McMoon-Dong Flower on Grand Park Walkway
After leaving Mokyeon-ri, go to Incheon Grand Park zelkova path. Zelkova trees are tunneled and romantic. Even before the autumn leaves are worth seeing. By mid-September, the purple McMoon-Dong flowers are present in India.
Oul Garden where you can see the flowers and cosmos
Lovers are encouraged to rent bicycles for couples at the bike square. If you rent a bicycle, you will go to the alumni garden of the Alumni side. In late September, buckwheat flowers are in full bloom. There are several beans in the middle of the buckwheat field. Why don't you read a book and make a fairy tale in autumn? Cosmos that sometimes fly adds to the mood of autumn.
Zelkova road couple bicycle
Alone Design Tour: Solo Yolo
Let's take a design tour for a trip alone. Incheon Grand Park Wood Culture Experience Center Mok Yeon Lee was noted as one of the 'hot' buildings in the first half, winning the World Architecture Community World Architecture Award after the Red Dot Design Award Concept Award.
Incheon Grand Park Wood Culture Experience Center
The first thing to look out for is the `` Ambience Wall, '' which decorates the first floor and the second floor. It is the name of the screen which stacked 8 ~ 9 wooden boards shaped like '∧' on the exterior of a building.
Ambience Wall is another highlight of shadow changes
I embodied our traditional door. The appearance varies depending on the direction you are looking, adding to the pleasure of taking pictures. Ambience Wall is a kinetic architecture (moving architecture) that distinguishes wood culture experiences from other architectural designs.
Ambience wall looks different depending on direction
There is also a hidden function. The stacked '∧' angle increases and decreases as the pole moves. However, it's a pity that you can't see it because it is only tested in special cases. Nevertheless, with that in mind, the building looks more abundant.
Building concrete wall wood pattern
For photography, we recommend a trail that enters from the park stand. Brown 'ambience walls' stand out among the pine branches. The interior contrasts the pattern of two-storey oak planks and ambience walls. At sunset, the shadows of the ambience wall change to create an interesting pattern. The concrete part of the building is colorful, expressing the texture of the tree.
Ambience Wall comes in a variety of photos depending on the direction

If you just feel sorry for Mokyeonri, you will take a walk to the Arboretum. Relaxing for about an hour along the forest path. If you walk alone, the trees in the forest seem to touch your heart.


Traffic tips: When using the subway in Seoul, it is faster to transfer the bus at Songnae Station than Incheon Grand Park Station. From July, the limited express (Yongsan Station-Dongincheon Station) subway will operate nine one-way trips (between 9:00 am and 5:00 pm). It takes 26 minutes from Yongsan Station to Songnae Station.

Arboretum entrance with willow

item.title: 4.5 billion Asian festivals! Compete for over 3000 medals in 36 events
item.description:
Opening ceremony of the 17th Incheon Asian Games

4.5 billion Asian festivals! Compete for over 3000 medals in 36 events

Seo-gu, Incheon, South Korea

On September 19, the 17th Incheon Asian Games started with the opening ceremony of Incheon Asiad Main Stadium in Incheon, Korea. 45 Asian countries, including Korea, China, and Japan, compete for over 3000 medals in 36 sports (28 Olympics and 8 Olympics) including basketball, rugby, archery, weightlifting, swimming, canoeing and boxing. The event, which includes all members of the Asian Olympic Council (OCA), including North Korea, will be held for 16 days until October 4. The third Asian Games to be held in Korea is the third after Seoul in 1986 and Busan in 2002. As of 2014, only Thailand (4) and South Korea have hosted more than three Asian Games.

Departure begins at the opening ceremony of Incheon Asiad Main Stadium on September 19, 2014
Before looking at the full schedule, let's take a look at the Incheon Asiad Main Stadium, which was completed for the Incheon Asian Games. It boasts a floor area of 11,620m2 (approximately 34,000 pyeong) and five floors and more than 60,000 seats. The competition started with the opening ceremony of Incheon Asiad Main Stadium. It is held in Incheon and Suwon Gymnasium (Handball), Munhak Park Tae-hwan Swimming Pool (Swimming). If you're a sports fan, it's a good idea to check the location of the stadium to create a line.
Opening Ceremony of 2014 Incheon Asian Games
A game of over 3000 medals. How should we look? Since we cannot introduce all the schedules, we arranged the schedules focusing on handball, swimming, archery, and gymnastics games loved by Koreans, mainly soccer, baseball, and basketball.
Opening Torch Light

First of all, the soccer became fun until the 2002 Korea-Japan World Cup. The final will take place at the Literature Stadium on October 2. In the soccer qualifiers held on September 21st, the Korean men's team beat Laos 2-0 and the women's team beat Maldives 13-0. Baseball, which started on the 22nd, won 15-0 against Thailand. The semi-finals and finals will take place on the 27th and 28th after the match against Hong Kong on the 24th. All take place at the Literary Baseball Stadium. Basketball is scheduled to play against Jordan at the Samsan World Gymnasium on the 25th. On the 28th, the quarter finals will be held at the Hwaseong Stadium.

Kim Young-Soo Chairman, Organizing Committee, Asian Games
Match schedule? It's not difficult!

Marine Boy Park Tae-hwan's swimming game is not to be missed. On the 21st, they won bronze medals in the men's freestyle 200m final and the men's freestyle 400m final on the 23rd. The freestyle 100m preliminaries are scheduled for 9 am on the 25th.

Gymnastics Fairy Son Yeon-jae will compete in the rhythmic gymnastics individual qualifiers on October 1 at Namdong Gymnasium. The rhythmic gymnastics consists of four events: ribbon, ball, club and hoop. There was a medal in gymnastics. On the 23rd, Lee Sang-wook won the bronze medal in the Men's Gymnastics Men's Final, and Yun Na-rae added another bronze medal in the Women's Individual Final. On the 24th, Yang Hak-sun will play in the final match of the gymnastics men's floor exercise, and will play against Li Segwang of North Korea. Gymnastics is the exercise of postponing body movements using machines. Express stability, difficulty, elegance and originality. Men's sports are Maru, Cheolbong, Parallel Bar, Massage, Ring, Chopping Board, and Women's Floor, Average Bar, Double Parallel Bar, Chopping Board.
Traditional medallion archery. The Republic of Korea breathes on a single arrow that cuts off the target. Archery won eight gold medals, including the 2014 Incheon Asian Games and the newly added compound. In the men's group qualification round (compound) held on the 23rd, Choi Yong-hee (2nd) and Yang Young-ho (5th) played in the men's individual qualification round. The women's team also took first place in the Compound Women's Qualifying Round and Choi Bo-min (1st) and Seok Ji-hyun (2nd) in the individual qualification round. The game is played every day until the 28th.
Wait here! There are two types of archery: a recurve bow and a compound bow. All archery we have seen in the meantime is recurve. Compound archery hasn't been an Olympic or Asian competition. However, attention has been increasing as it was adopted as a regular sport since the Incheon Asian Games. What is the difference between the two? As the name implies, the bow structure is different. If the recurve is a traditional bow, the compound is a mechanical bow. The recurve is heavy and sensitive, so the player's concentration is important. Thinking of the archery field in the meantime makes it easier to understand. Compounds, on the other hand, are lighter and smaller than mechanical arrowhead recurve arrows that are easy to learn for beginners with pulleys and sights.
In the finals of the badminton men's team where the opposition hero Lee Yong-dae played on the 23rd, he added a gold medal. The men's and women's mixed singles and doubles games will be held until the 29th. In addition, medal competitions will be held in 36 events including judo, shooting, cycling, and land. As of September 24, 2014, South Korea is ranked second overall with 61 medals, including 20 gold, 19 silver and 22 bronze.
Judo Qualification
Indeed, don't forget the seal of three children, Vichuon, Barame, and Chumyeon, the mascots of the Incheon Asian Games. The mascot of the convention has influenced the image of the competition. As the name suggests, the eldest son of the Incheon Asian Games, Bichuon, is, as the name suggests, 'the messenger of light shining hope on the whole world'. Was taken from. Why don't you enjoy the festival of autumn, wind, light and wind?
Panoramic view of Literary Park Tae Hwan Swimming Pool
